Vanessa has now had the business for seven years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand the business.  Vanessa is currently applying for a loan to buy onions, pumpkins and tomatoes.  

Vanessa is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy onions, pumpkins and tomatoes.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 38 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y sorgo desde hace varios años, es un hombre responsable y trabajador vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para su siembra como abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que tiene buena clientela y quiere seguir con sus cosechas para obtener mejores ganacias y seguir dandole a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en: Miguel, 38, has been growing corn and sorghum for several years.  He is a responsible, hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife and children.  The income he is able to earn is to cover household expenses, so he is requesting a loan to buy everything he needs for planting, such as fertilizers, seeds, etc.  He has a good clientele and wants to continue with his crop growing in order to earn more profit and continue giving his family everything they need.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies (fertilizers and seeds).

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas; gracias a su trabajo ya está en su ciclo 3 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde casi todas las integrantes ya lograron superar la línea de pobreza; a través del Aumento de Ingreso donde aprendieron la Elaboración de Productos de Limpiezas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian, quien en su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza esta en el nivel dos, y eso es lo que la motiva aun mas para poder esforzarse y salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas y venta de Bebidas, también se debe destacar el trabajo que esta Sra. esta haciendo, ya que se esfuerza mucho por aprender y día a día superarse. Su meta es poder tener algún día un gran negocio de comidas y seguir deleitando a su clientela con todas las ricas comidas que hace.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Gaseosas, materia prima para la elaboración de la comida carne, harina, huevo entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called Mujeres Unidas [United Women], is in its third cycle of the women committee program, thanks to its members’ work. They took part in the poverty eradication survey, and most of them were found to be above the poverty line. They learned how to make cleaning products through a program to increase their income.

One of the members is Mrs. Mirian, who is in poverty level 2 according to the survey, something that inspires her to work harder and get ahead. Mirian sells empanadas [stuffed bread or pastry baked or fried] and beverages. It is important to highlight her effort to learn and improve more every day. Her goal is to have her own food business one day and continue to delight her customers with the delicious foods she prepares.

Mirian is requesting this loan to buy beverages and ingredients for her food, such as meat, flour and eggs. This will help her to make her business plan a reality and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy beverages and ingredients to prepare food, like meat, flour and eggs.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: Nació en un hogar muy humilde carente de muchas cosas, y con un padre poco responsable su madre vivió con el después del nacimiento de ella  cinco años tarde,  luego se separaron porque su padre les daba mala vida, no los alimentaba y los maltrataba; su madre decidió darse una oportunidad en el amor y la llevo con ella a vivir con otro señor que aparentemente los quería, después de 6 largos años la convivencia con este señor se hizo demasiado imposible por sus malas intenciones  para con ella y con tan solo 13 años de edad decidió  hacerse cargo de su vida con el apoyo de su abuela materna, en una ciudad pequeña no importa la edad solo importa las ganas de trabajar para emplear a alguien y eso le sucedió a ella entonces se vio obligada a dejar sus estudios en el colegio y ponerse a trabajar dure así un año mientras se reponía de todos los daños que este señor le había causado en cuestión de ropa, libros del colegio y calzado, entre otros luego de ese tiempo decidió ingresar a estudiar validando los dos años que le faltaban (décimo y once), con el dinero que se ganaba compro los útiles, uniformes y matricula, acorde con el jefe en ese entonces que la dejara trabajar hasta las seis de la tarde para entrar al colegio a las seis treinta  acepto y así logro estudiar y trabajar seis meses porque resulta que al señor  no le servía que ella se fuera tan temprano pues su jornada normal era de todo el día. Siguió estudiando con lo poco que le podía ayudar su abuela y culmino exitosa mente el bachiller, se mudo a una ciudad  en el 2006, para ese tiempo tenía 16 años  quería trabajar pero era más complicado que en su pueblo,  aun así lo consiguió con un amigo  que tenía un local pequeño donde vendía gorras y correas allí conoció a la persona que ahora es su esposo e iniciaron una bonita relación, su  anhelo siempre ha sido seguir estudiando porque ella ha tenido muy claro que es lo único que ayuda a salir adelante, ingreso a un instituto  estudio un semestre de secretariado y tuvo que retirarse por que resulto embarazada y su embarazo era de alto riesgo, conformo su hogar con el padre de la niña y se dedico a las cosas de la casa y no estudiaba  por cuestión de dinero, tampoco trabajaba por estar con la bebe (actualmente una niña de 5 años), en la actualidad está estudiando gracias a Dios y al esfuerzo que están haciendo pues vivir  tres con un solo salario es complicado  pero se sabe que es una gran inversión para las vidas teniendo en cuenta una oferta laboral mejor remunerada, un ingreso más alto, en la casa no tienen  mucho hay veces que se ven alcanzados ya que no tiene para la mensualidad pero confiamos en Dios y eso les da aliento para confiar que todo estará mejor. Tiene una familia muy unida, cariñosa y por la cual se esfuerza y valora la oportunidad de estar estudiando disfruta cada día que pasa con su hija y trata de enseñarle que hay que luchar por los sueños sin pasar por encima de los demás.
texts.en:
She was born in a very humble home deprived of many things and with an unresponsible father.  Her mother lived with him after the baby was born but five years later they got divorced because of his bad behavior.  He did not feed them and was abusive.  Her mother decided give herself another opportunity for love and she took her daughter to live with another man who apparently loved them.  After six long years of living with this man, his bad intentions toward her made life impossible, so at age 13 she decided to live her own life with the support of her maternal grandmother.  In a small city, it is not the age that matters but rather the determination to work, so this is why she left school and started to work.  She lasted a year doing this while recovering from the harm this man had caused her, in matters of clothing, text books, and shoes, among other things.  After that she decided to go back to school to finish the two years she needed for high school (10th and 11th grades).  She used the money she had earned to buy supplies and uniforms and pay for tuition.  Her boss allowed her to quit work at 6:00 p.m. so that she could go to school at 6:30 p.m.  She was able to study and work for six months, but her boss finally said she was leaving too early at a job that was supposed to last all day.

She continued her studies with the help of her grandmother and finished high school successfully.  She moved to another city in 2006 at age 16 and wanted to work but it was more complicated than in her town.  But she was able to get a job through a friend who had a small hat and belt business.  There she met the person who is now her husband and they began a nice relationship.  She always wanted to continue studying because she felt that was the only way to get ahead.  She began secretarial studies at an academy but had to quit because she got pregnant and it was a high risk pregnancy.  She set up house with the father of her daughter and began to take care of the home and could not continue studying due to financial reasons.  Nor could she work because of the baby (who is now five years old).  Thankfully, she is studying again through much effort because it is difficult for three people to live off of one income.  But she knows it is a great investment for their lives because there will be more well-paid work on offer.  Sometimes there is not enough money at home and they cannot even afford the monthly rent, but they trust in God and that helps them believe things will get better.  She has a very united, caring family who she works hard for.  She values the opportunity to study and to enjoy every day she has with her daughter.  She tries to teach her that one much fight for one's goals without hurting anyone along the way.

loans.use: To finish her accounting education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Yanira

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de comprar productos  tales como: maíz, quesillo, aceite, chicharrón, gas, entre otros para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
El crédito anterior le permitió crecer en el negocio, aumentar la clientela y así obtuvo ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan to buy products such as corn, cheese, oil, pork rinds, gas and other items to continue strengthening her business.

The previous loan allowed her to expand her business, increase clientele and earn a profit.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, oil, pork rinds, gas and other items.

loans.name: Jimbere Group

texts.fr:
Donatien fait partie du groupe Jimbere et  habite à Ruyigi. Il  a 33 ans et est marié à Marguerite, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de haricot et de la bière depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est à son septième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer de la bière, à vendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Donatien is part of the Jimbere group and lives in Ruyigi. He is 33 years old and is married to Margaret, a farmer. Together they have four children, all attending school.

He has been trading beans and beer for the past ten years.

This is his seventh credit loan with Turame. Once he obtains the KIVA loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to prepare beer for sale, and so increase his earnings.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to prepare beer for sale, and so increase his earnings.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old, married and was blessed with eight children. She and her family live in a rural community and make a living in farming.

Due to financial constraints and to generate additional income, Marilou runs a small general store in her village. She would like to buy more grocery items to sell but she has insufficient capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to stock up on soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps and dried fish for resale. 

She believes this loan will help her improve her business and hopes that she can make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Martha Estela

texts.es:
Martha, posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive en casa propia junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella ya tiene 14 años de dedicarse a su negocio, el cual lo inicio con fondos propios de hace desde hace 15 años. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de productos de consumo basico para el hogar como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, entre otros para ofrecerles más mercadería a  los clientes. Este le ayudara a incrementar el volumen de su negocio con el objetivo de fortalecer los ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
Su sueño es aumentar el negocio, brindarle ayuda a su hijo académicamente para que se supere y tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Martha runs a shop selling essential items. She lives in her own house together with her 11-year-old son. She has earned her living from this business for 14 years. She started the business 15 years ago with her own money. 

She is asking for a loan to buy basic consumable products for we home such as rice, beans and sugar so that she can offer her customers more merchandise. This will help her to increase the volume of her business with the aim of increasing her income and improving her quality of life. Her dream is to expand her business and help her son academically so that he succeeds and has the opportunity for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy basic consumable items such as rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar,  solicita un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de más capital para invertir en el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Este le ayudara a comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para llevar acabo el cultivo con todo lo necesario en el momento oportuno.
El préstamo anterior le permitió fortalecer el capital de trabajo y con las ganancias a logrado aportar  a su familia. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ya que sus hijos siguen estudiando gracias a la ayuda que ella le brinda por lo que su sueño es formarlos académicamente y sean profesionales de éxito en el fututo.
texts.en:
Oscar is asking for a new loan because he needs more capital to invest in growing corn and beans. This will help him to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticides and insecticides to grow his crop with everything he needs at the right time. 

The previous loan allowed him to strengthen his working capital and with the earnings he has been able to support his family. His family circumstances have improved, since his children are still in school thanks to the help offered. His dream is for them to be educated and have successful careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticide.

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Reina, tiene una tienda de productos varios. Ella tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y vive en casa propia, disfruta de dos hijos los cuales están estudiando. Reina, vende productos de primera necesidad, posee diez años de experiencia de laborar en este oficio, lo cual lo realiza todos los días de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm, ya que está ubicado en su vivienda.
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería tales como: frijoles, azucar, arroz, sal, entre otros para ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de productos y estos queden satisfechos. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su negocio, ya que por medio de este obtiene ganancias para el sustento de y su familia.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y logren ser profesionales de éxitos en el futuro, brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Reina has a store where she sells various products. She is 51 years old. She is married, lives in her own home, and enjoys her children who are in school.   Reina sells staple products. She has ten years experience working in this profession, which she does every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., since the store is in her house.  

The loan she needs will be invested in buying merchandise such as beans, sugar, rice. salt and more to offer her customers a variety of products so they will be satisfied. This investment will help improve her business, since this way she will make profits to support her family.

Her dream is for her children to stay in school and have successful careers in the future, and to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beans, sugar, rice, salt and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Mclaren Group

texts.en:
Davis, who is in his mid 50s is married with six children who still go to school. He has been running a general store for fifteen years now. He works from 7.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Davis's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock on missing items in his store and started an electronic money transfer (M-pesa and Tigo Pesa) business. He is very hard working. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully, and has been using his profits to pay school fees, build his house and cover household expenses. 

Davis will use this loan to increase the inventory of his general store and to make more electronic money transfers. His dream is to one day be able to build another house to rent.

Davis will share this loan with his loan group "Mclaren" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his general store and to make more electronic money transfers.

loans.name: Neisser

texts.es: Neisser compró moldes y materiales con los que elaboró muchos productos que vendió,  su meta es incrementar su producción gradualmente y generar mayores utilidades. Neisser envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Agradecimientos por creer en los microempresarios”. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará moldes y materiales,  para una vez mas,  producir todo lo que su clientela requiere y hacer de su credikiva toda una inversión exitosa..
texts.en:
Neisser bought molds and materials.  He used them to create a lot of products which he then sold.  His goal is to gradually increase his production and make more profits.  Neisser sends the following message to Kiva lenders "Thank you for believing in micro businesspeople".  

Neisser is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy molds and materials so that he can, once again, produce everything his customers request and turn his Kiva loan into a really successful investment.

loans.use: to buy molds and materials

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesus con su anterior credikiva compró dos lavadoras mas, con ellas aumentó el número de sus clientes y así mismo sus ingesos. Con su credikiva el negocio se ha fortalecido y ha avanzado por eso envió agradecimientos por el apoyo que Kiva ha hecho a su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando nuevamente a un credikiva para adicionar a su actividad diaria, dos computadores y  prestar el servicio de internet de una manera mas efectiva porque en la actuaidad cuenta con 3  y tiene planes de continuar creciendo, aumentando sun inversiones.
texts.en:
Jesus bought two washing machines with his previous loan, which brought him more clients and more income. His business has grown with the loan, so he is very thankful for Kiva's support.

He his currently applying for a new loan to buy two computers and provide internet services more efficiently. He currently has three computers and plans to keep growing by investing more.

loans.use: to buy two computers

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BADEGNA est constitué de 6 femmes mariées et 1 veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pomme à l’image de
MAMA, qui est la troisième femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de pomme avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Badegna group is made up of six married women and one widow, who, on average, are 34 years old and have three children. They live in traditional, extended families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of the town of Bougouni. They know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their commerce, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second loan. Their first loan was repaid correctly. 

This group of women sell apples. Mama, who is the third woman from the right in the photo, plans to buy two cartons of apples from the wholesalers in Bamako with her loan. She makes her sales in a market and from home, for cash and credit to customers who are men and women. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in their businesses and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy apples

loans.name: Merys De Jesus

texts.es: Merys aumentó sus ingresos y el capital de trabajo del negocio que tiene hoy en su casa propia y esto fue  gracias a su credikiva, con el cual compró útiles de papelería y papel para fotocopiaje. Siente que su negocio tiene futuro y por eso acude una vez mas a su credikiva, nuevo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fotocopiadora pues la que tiene es muy pequeño para responder al número de habitantes que solicitan el servicio  de fotocopiaje. Su mayor potencial de ventas lo genera la ubicación del negocio que se encuentra cerca a instituciones educativas donde los estudiantes son sus principales clientes.
texts.en:
Merys increased her income and the working capital of the business she runs at home, thanks to her credikiva. She bought stationery items and copy paper. She sees a bright future for her business and this is why she is requesting a credikiva again, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

With this loan, Merys will buy a copy machine, since the one she has is too small and cannot cope with her customers’ demands. Her strategic location, close to academic institutions, represents a great advantage for her sales, since students are her main customers.

loans.use: to buy a copy machine.

loans.name: Giovanny Andrés

texts.es: Su nombre es Giovanny tiene 21 años. Es  estudiante del programa ensamble, programación y mantenimiento de Hardware, le gusta mucho esa carrera y lo motiva a seguir adelante con sus estudios. En la actualidad lamentablemente no tiene como sostener a su papá y a si mismo ya que vive con él y lastimosamente ninguno de los dos tiene un trabajo estable, su único trabajo es en un bar solo los viernes y trabaja toda la noche, no tiene un sueldo fijo, además de eso su papá trabaja en las noches en un carro ambulante vendiendo variedad de comestibles empacados, en este momento más que nunca están pasando por una situación difícil, a su papá le quitaron su único medio de trabajo… Siguiendo con la historia el no tiene un solvente económico de ninguna índole y por supuesto no quiere perder la oportunidad que con tanto esfuerzo logro (la de estudiar) para èl desde que salió del colegio en el año 2008 fue algo primordial, estar en una universidad, porque sabe y está convencido que si se estudia se llega muy lejos, y eso es lo que quiere, ser un Gran Ingeniero de sistemas porque es lo que le apasiona, por este motivo no quiere que su esfuerzo sea en vano.
texts.en:
This young man's name is Giovanny and he is 21 years old.  He is a student, studying hardware assembly, programming and maintenance.  He really likes his field and this motivates him to make progress in his studies.

Giovanny lives with his father but, unfortunately, he is unable to support him right now.  Neither of the pair have a stable job.  Giovanny's only work is in a bar.  He only works Fridays but works all night.  He does not receive a fixed wage.  His father works nights with a cart, selling packaged foodstuffs as an itinerant vendor.  Right now, more than ever, Giovanny and his father are experiencing a difficult situation as they just took away his father's only means of work.... Continuing with the story, Giovanny doesn't have any kind of financial support right now.  However, he doesn't want to lose the opportunity that he worked so hard for (the opportunity to study).  Going to university has been of paramount importance to him since he left school in 2008 because he knows that if he studies he will go far in life.  Giovanny wants to become a successful systems engineer because it is what he is passionate about.  He does not want all his hard work to have been in vain.

loans.use: to finish his program in hardware assembly and maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables for her husband's vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Elmo

texts.en:
Elmo is 22 years old and single. Due to a lack of job opportunities, he runs a small variety store in his village to help his parents generate income. He wishes to improve his business by making it profitable in order to generate sufficient income. This will enable him to save for his future and help his parents finance the education of his younger brother. 

Due to insufficient capital, Elmo is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of breads, seasonings, beverages, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, laundry soaps and soft drinks to sell. Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of breads, seasonings, beverages, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, laundry soaps and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Brenda aimed to improve her hog-raising business in order to generate sufficient income. She is 30 years old and has three children. She and her husband aimed to uplift their source of living in order to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of their children. Because of this, Brenda aims to raise more pigs to sell. She is asking for an additional capital of 41,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Despite the problems and difficulties in her life, she believes that she will improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy nail polish and remover, nail files, cuticle trimmers, and other supplies

loans.name: Freda

texts.es:
Freda tiene 21 años de edad , esta casada con Jhover y tiene una hija pequeña , juntos viven en una casa construida a base de madera .Desde niña fue instruida en las diversas labores agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico siendo este el principal sustento de su familia .
Con el paso de los años y al comprometerse con su esposo logró independizarse con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le brindaron en calidad de herencia unas parcelas para el sustento de su familia.
Lleva casi 4 años  en el rubro y por tener una hija pequeña ha optado por iniciar un pequeño negocio dedicado a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y complementarlo con golosinas y demás consumibles cerca a la cancha deportiva de su barrio, esperando tener como principal clientela a sus vecinos .De esta manera propone aportar su granito de arena para lograr a largo plazo mejorar su calidad de vida teniendo como objetivo aperturar una tienda mas grande de productos comestibles.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva el cual comenta es una buena herramienta de trabajo.Desea para esta primera oportunidad contar con S/. 1,500 nuevos soles e invertirlos en la compra de golosinas, galletas, bebidas rehidratantes  y gasificadas.
texts.en:
Freda is twenty-one years old, is married to Jhover, and has a small daughter.  Together, they live in a wooden house.  From a young age, she was taught different agricultural tasks and work related to the production of cacao and organic coffee, this being the main livelihood of her family.  As the years passed and she married her husband, she was able to become independent through the support of her parents; they offered her an inheritance of some plots of land for the maintenance of her own family.  

She had been in this business for almost four years, but in having a young daughter, she decided to start a small business selling carbonated drinks, snacks, and other items, near a court where people play sports in her neighborhood.  She hopes that her neighbors will be her main customer base.  In this way, she hopes to put in the effort now in order to achieve a better quality of life in the long-run, her final objective being to open a larger foods store.  

This is her first loan with Kiva, which she says is a good tool for work.  She hopes that in her first opportunity, she will receive 1,500 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of snacks, crackers, rehydration beverages and carbonated drinks.

loans.use: to buy snacks, crackers, and other items.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Dos de las integrantes de este grupo, han mostrado en su encuentra de eliminación de pobreza, que tienen un ingreso muy por debajo. Este grupo está en su sexto ciclo, y con mucho esfuerzo trabajo y están saliendo adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bernarda, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que siempre le va muy bien en las ventas. Ella se esfuerza por mejorar su economía y la de su familia, es por eso que se esta esforzando mucho.
Bernarda solicita este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, shorts, camisas y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas y generando los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo  ella y sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
Two of the members of this group showed during their 'making poverty history' meeting that their income puts them well below the poverty line.  This group is in its sixth loan cycle.  Its members are working hard and making progress.

One of the members of the group is Bernarda whose business is selling clothes.  She says that she has a good customer base and she always makes very good sales.  She is working very hard to improve her family's financial situation.

Bernarda is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothing such as t-shirts, shorts, shirts, etc. so that she can continue selling and making income with which to help her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members are receiving.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, shirts and other items of clothing

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, San is 50 years old and married. She has three children to whom she caters, as they are still in school. 

San farms rice on a seven-hectare area. She has 20 years' experience in her current business, which yields about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Now, San is the leader in a group consisting of five members. She is the second-cycled client and has completely repaid her past loans wisely. Her living status is getting better every day, thanks to a positive outcome from her previous loans. 

The total amount of her group loan is 5,200,000 KHR. San will spend her portion of the loan (500,000 KHR) to buy rice seeds. In the future, she hopes to grow her rice in a timely fashion and gain multiple incomes for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Estrelita is a hardworking mother who raises hogs in her village to help her husband earn income. She is 48 years old and has been gifted with four siblings. Two of her siblings are still in college and they want to finish their studies in order to earn a degree. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Estrelita plans to raise more pigs to sell. However, due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through her patience and hard work, Estrelita believes that she will be able to improve her business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is a 37-year-old married woman who lives with her son, daughter and spouse. Both of her children attend high school. She supports her family by operating a jewelry selling business with support from her husband.
She started her business in 1998 when she rented a stall.  She now she has about 4,000,000 MNT in working capital. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more jewelry to sell since the spring is a popular season to sell jewelry.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: A 51-year-old mother of seven children, Lai lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province and makes a living by working for others for a fee. She does this to support the entire household. She has been doing this for eight years. Lai is a first time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking this loan to renovate her latrine by constructing a concrete wall. She hopes this loan will help her fix her latrine so that she has a proper latrine which can be used for ages.

loans.use: to renovate her latrine by constructing a concrete wall.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat is 48 years old and lives in the EK Phnom district of Battambang province. She is a mother of six children. To feed the entire household, she raises chickens as her main source of income while her husband works at construction site. Rat is not a first time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has managed her past loan in a smart way, being able to support a decent lifestyle for her family, and her business is in good shape. This group consists of two females, with Rat being the group leader. The total amount of her requested loan is 1,800,000 KHR, with 1,400,000 KHR being her portion. Rat will use her loan portion to buy more chickens to raise. She hopes to earn more income for her family so she can improve their living standards even further.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Momos Group

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Demetria  de estado civil casada, cuenta con 39 años de edad, estudió 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 3 están estudiando, se dedica a vender medicina natural, inició este negocio vendiendo medicina en las calles y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de medicina para poder revenderlo, en el futuro no muy lejano quiere contar con otro local para tener mayor rentabilidad; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agropecuarias y al comercio.

en la fotografía aparecen solo 8 integrantes, ya que los otros no pudieron asistir a esa reunión.
texts.en:
Hilda Demetria is 39 years old, married, and completed 3 years of 'educación primaria' (education for children aged 7-14).  She has four children, three of whom are in school.  Hilda Demetria's business is selling natural medicines.  She started out selling medicines in the streets and currently has 15 years experience.

Hilda Demetria formed a group so that she could request a loan to buy medicines for re-sale.  In the not-so-distant future, she would like to have another sales location so that she can make more profits.  The other members of her group work in farming and commerce.

*Only eight members of the group appear in this photo as some were unable to attend the meeting.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. for his business

loans.name: Malat's Group

texts.en: Malart is 25 years old and married.  She and her husband are blessed with three children who all attend school. Rice cultivation is her main source of income while her husband earns additional income by repairing motorbikes. Malart has been cultivating rice for 10 years and earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. Malat is not a first time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid back her past loan with success. The loan enabled her to upgrade her living standards and to better support her business. Now she is in a group consisting of two female members. She is seeking a loan for 1,400,000 KHR and her group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees plus transplanting fees. She hopes that her business will grow at a steady pace and her crops will have a high yield allowing her to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees plus transplanting fees.

loans.name: Thoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Thoeurng is 28 years old and resides in Banteay Meanchey province. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She has managed four hectares of rice growing, which she has been with for nine years. She is able to earn up to 15,000 KHR per day. 

Thoeurng, a third time borrower, is in a group of four to apply for a new loan. The past loans have had a positive effect to improve her living and especially to enable her to keep her children in school. She is now seeking 1,000,000 KHR whereas her joint members are applying for 200,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seed for the upcoming replanting season. 

She hopes to earn more income and upgrade her living progressively.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for the upcoming replanting season.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking mother who helps her husband in gaining income. She is 54 years old and has four adult children. 

Due to financial constraints, Gloria helps her husband in planting vegetables in their backyard for sale. She aims to plant more kinds of vegetables but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, Gloria is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. 

Being an industrious woman, she believes that she will increase her vegetable production to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Urandari

texts.en:
Urandari is 28 years old, married, and has one daughter who attends school and a son who is only ten months old.  They live in a small house in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is a taxi driver. Urandari’s mother, who lives with them, is retired.

Urandari supported her family by operating a retail stall at the local accessories shop. Before, she sold clothes and accessories at a low price. Then she operated retail, in which all goods sold for 1.000 MNT. But now she rents a small grocery store from her sister. She is planning to expand her current business so that she can rehabilitate her own small house.

With this loan of 3,000,000 MNT, Urandari will purchase more products to sell. She wants to use this loan to help support her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Esty Group

texts.en:
ESTY group consists of three partners all from Dansoman. They are Esther, Gifty and Edward. They sell provisions, beans and footwear, respectively. They have been together since 2010. 

Esther is 46 years old. She has three children. She needs GHS 2,000 to buy milk, rice, soap and canned fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for the past three years and is doing very well. She is very loyal and truthful with the loans she has taken from ID Ghana and now is applying for her eighth loan to meet her customers’ demands. 

The entire group needs an amount totaling GHS 4,100 to expand and buy more goods to meet the demands of their respective customers

loans.use: To buy more milk, rice, soap and canned fish and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nafraq

texts.en:
Nafraq is a 49-year-old independent woman. Her husband is a government employee, and five of her children are currently studying in schools. They are facing many problems in life due to financial constraints. 

Nafraq has been successfully running a tuition center in her home for seven years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase chairs and some required furniture for her tuition center. She wants to increase the seating capacity so she can teach more children in one room and her monthly income could be increased. She would use the profit amount to expand the center by the construction of one more room. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her academy.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2010. They are Benjamin, Mercy and Salomey. Ben is a tailor, Mercy sells tea and Salomey is a hairdresser. They reside in the Dansoman community.

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Benjamin is a 39-year-old tailor. He has eight years of experience in his business. He works six days in a week (from Monday to Saturday). He is constantly working to improve his business capital. 

This is his sixth loan with ID-Ghana, and he is requesting an amount of 700 GHS (Ghana cedis) to buy more materials to sell to his customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of 2,600 GHS for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rizwana Group

texts.en:
Rizwana is a 60-year-old responsible housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and four children. Her husband has been running a television sales business for seven years. 

Rizwana, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can expand his business. He would buy new models of television sets, as the old ones have no demand now. His sales would be increased with the newer models available in his shop, which will attract more customers. With the profit amount, Rizwana would pay the educational expenses of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

NOTE: Rizwana is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase new television sets for her husband's television business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jewels and gum for pasting jewels on clothes.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a wooden house located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, 44-year-old Kan is married and blessed with four children. To sustain the family, she grows mangoes on one-and-one-half hectares of land, while her husband grows rice on a one-hectare plot. Her business yields about 5,400 KHR in income per day.

Kan received a previous loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) which helped her to build a decent house with a proper latrine for her family. Now she is leading a group of five to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Kan will use her loan portion to buy potash and insecticide for her mango trees. She hopes to minimize losses due to pests and secure a high yield, thereby enabling her to enhance her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide for her mango trees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her sewing business.

loans.name: Christian Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Christian vive en libertad tiene 32 años, EL enpeso como ayudante en un local del vecino hasta que aprendo y se puso su propio local de fibra.

el trabaja con su hermano y realiza el trabajo en su domicilio. Sus dificultad es la electricidad y los ladrones.
es casado y su esposa se dedica a la compra y venta de pescados.

Tiene un hijo de 5 años y estudia en una escuela fiscal. Con el prestamo va a comprar fibra, pinturas para mejorar su negocio.  Su meta es tener su propia empresa de fibra.
texts.en:
Christian, age 32, lives in Libertad.  He started as a helper at his neighbor’s place until he learned.  Then he set up his own fiber place.

He works at home with his brother.  The difficulty he has is the electricity and the thieves.

He is married, and his wife buys and sells fish.

He has a five year old child, who attends public school.

He will use the loan to buy fiber and paints to improve his business.  His goal is to have his own fiber company.

loans.use: to buy fiber, paint, and a machine.

loans.name: Adolfo Candido

texts.es: Don Adolfo, un señor trabajador junto a su esposa e hijos, continua su labor del cultivo de papaya y guayaba, desde hace muchos años vendiendo estas riquísimas frutas, actualmente solicita un octavo crédito para darle mantenimiento a sus siembros, para lograr siempre buenos frutos y darlos a buen precio, lo que le permitirá cubrir los gastos del hogar, espera que en este año le vaya bien y que la sequia no le afecte la plantacion.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a hard-working man who, together with his wife and children, continues growing papaya and guava.  He has been selling these delicious fruits for many years.

Adolfo is requesting his eighth loan so that he can maintain his crops and continue growing good fruit to sell at a good price.  This will allow him to cover his household expenses.  Adolfo hopes that this year goes well for him and that the drought does not affect his crops.

loans.use: to buy urea and complete fertilizers

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de madera, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de madera, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de madera al por mayor ya que tiene pedidos y quiere abastecerse de este producto y así generar más ingresos esta época ya que incremento su clientela.
texts.en: Miguel continues working in the same business: selling wood.  He says that his previous loan worked out well as he used it to buy wood.  On this occasion, Miguel is requesting a loan to buy more wood wholesale as his number of customers has increased, he has orders, and he would like to stock up.  This will make him more income.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  KAYIRA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Heremakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de SALI, assise, troisième de la droite vers la gauche un mouchoir rouge à la tête. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1500 Kilos de céréales  avec les paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kayira group is made up of six women, all married and who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They live in traditional, extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the Heremakono Centre neighborhood of the town of Bougouni. They know each other from neighbordhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their commerce, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their fifth loan. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly. 

This group of women sells cereals. Sali, who is seated third from the right and is wearing a red headscarf, plans to buy 1,500 kilograms of cereals from peasant producers. 

Sali makes her sales in a market and from home, for cash and credit to customers who are men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which will be invested back in the businesses and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Age 47 and a mother of five children, Thy is a local villager from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. For her family, arum planting and rice cropping are the main source of family income which has provided her about 6,500 KHR per day. She has been engaged in the current business for 28 years and is able to save about 2,000 KHR per day from her income after offsetting the expenses. 

Including this loan, she is a second-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  With her first loan she is able to better support her living in a gradual manner and managed to buy a decent motorbike for her family. In need of working capital to buy good arum seedlings and rice seed, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. She hopes that this loan will help her to grow both of her cash crops on time and get back more yield. (Arum has an edible root, a source of starch.)

loans.use: To buy a good arum seed and rice seed.

loans.name: Shakeela Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 39-year-old diligent and hardworking woman. Her husband is a carpenter and she is helping him to meet the household expenses by selling dried fruits. She has been doing this business for 12 years. She has four children and three of them are currently studying in schools.

Shakeela, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a large quantity of dry fruits like peanuts, apricots, etc. from the village at a cheaper rate and then sell it for a profit. She would also do the proper packaging of her dry fruits through which her sales would be increased. Shakeela is very hopeful that the loan would have a positive impact on her life.

NOTE: In the picture Shakeela is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits like peanuts, apricots etc. and packaging for them.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 22-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband. Rabia is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2011 she has been operating her own beauty salon.
 
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a new variety of beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits and hair colors to satisfy her clients more professionally. With the profit amount she would expand her business by constructing one more room for her salon, as the current space is very congested. She dreams of living a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her husband. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos vive en La Libertad, el tiene 24 años de edad. El tenia que buscar una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su familia y así poder tener más fuente de ingresos para su hogar.

El recoge y compra material de reciclaje del botadero para luego venderla y así tener más fuente de ingresos para su hogar. El solo tiene una dificultad en su trabajo es su salud que aveces se ve afectada y en esos días no tiene ingresos económicos para su familia.

El está en unión libre, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres domésticos. El tiene una hija pero todavía no está en edad de estudiar. 

El usara el préstamo para usar lo en su negocio de reciclajede plastico, vidrio, carton. El desea para el futuro mejorar sus ingresos y tener capital para adquirir el reciclaje.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 24, lives in La Libertad.  He had to look for a source of income in order to help his family.  This way he is able to have more income for his household.

He gathers and buys recycling material from the garbage dump to later sell.  This way he has a greater source of income for his home.  He only has one difficulty in his work, which is his health.  Sometimes he is affected, and on those days he does not have financial income for his family.

He is in a common-law marriage, and his wife takes care of the domestic chores.  His has a daughter, but she is not yet school age.

He will use the loan for his business of recycling plastic, glass, and cardboard. 

In the future he wishes to improve his income and to have the capital to purchase the recycling.

loans.use: to recycle plastic, glass, and cardboard.

loans.name: Diana Rocio

texts.es:
Ella es Diana es madre cabeza de hogar tiene 2 hijos el mayor tiene 17 años se llama Javier el año pasado por cuestiones económicas no lo pudo matricular en la universidad en este momento está  en la casa,  con fe y trabajando bastante el próximo semestre entrara.... Su  otro hijo tiene 4 años se llama Oscar esta en el jardín y gracias a Dios esta escolarizado... Ella trabaja por días en casas de familia o como cuidadora para los adultos mayores  pero es esporádico, vive en un apartamento arrendado  ella cubre todos los gastos de la casa, no tienen  lujos ni puede darle  a sus hijos cosas que  piden pero trata de darles lo que puede y dentro de sus posibilidades económicas , deben  restringirse  en muchas cosas pero si quieren  algo tiene  que sacrificar varias cosas,   por el momento estudia esta carrera con la expectativa que con ella puede salir adelante y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a ellos y a su  madre.  Tiene  a su  madre Rocio quien tiene 56 años, por cuestiones de edad a ella no la reciben para trabajar por la edad ella es auxiliar de enfermería del sena pero la edad ya la sociedad y por protocolos de las instituciones ya no la dejan..  Su madre le colabora con los niños mientras sale a trabajar y estudiar ,,,, 

Hace 3 años se separo por maltrato intra-familiar, por lo cual no volvió a comunicarse con el papa de sus hijos para la parte económico de mis hijos. 

Ha  salido sola dentro de  lo que cabe , con respecto a lo del convenio  le ayudaría mucho pues tendría para ayudarle a su hijo el mayor para sus trasporte cuando entre a estudiar en junio y para los gastos de la casa. Gracias a la institución que le dio la oportunidad de estar en las clases entro un poco tarde ya habían empezado las clases pero gracias al  interés que presento  ya esta adelantada y va bien con las notas y espera seguir así,  hasta el día de la graduación.
texts.en:
Diana is a single mother and head of household.  She has two children.  Her eldest, Javier, is 17 years old.  Last year, for financial reasons, she was unable to enroll him in college.  He is currently at home.  With faith and hard work, she hopes that he will be able to start university next semester.  Diana's other son, Oscar, is 4 years old.   He is in pre-school and, thanks to God, he is receiving an education.

Diana works as a carer in family homes, looking after adults.  However, the work is sporadic.  She lives in a rented apartment and covers all the household expenses herself.  The family don't have any luxuries, nor can Diana give her children things they ask for, but she tries to give them what she can within her means.  They have to miss out on a lot of things and, if they really want something, Diana has to make sacrifices.

Diana is currently studying in the hopes that she will be able to get ahead and provide a better quality of life for her children and her mother.  Diana's mother, Rocio, is 56 years old.  Owing to her age, Rocio is out of work.  She was a nurse's aide with SENA (the Colombian National Learning Service) but, as a result of her age, the way society is and institutional protocols, she is no longer able to work.  Instead, Rocio helps out with the children while Diana goes out to work and attends college.

Three years ago, Diana separated from her husband because of domestic abuse.  She no longer has any contact with her children's father and he does not help out financially.  Diana has done her best.  This agreement will help her a lot as she will need to help her eldest son with transportation costs when he starts studying in June and she also has household expenses to cover.  Thankfully, the Institution provided the opportunity to attend classes.  She started a little late, when classes had already begun, but thanks to the interest she showed, she is now ahead in her studies and receiving good grades.  She hopes to continue in this way right up until graduation day.

loans.use: to complete her studies as a nurse's aide

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is from the Vayots Dzor region. He is a young farmer and has been involved in agriculture for many years. He lives with his parents and sister and jointly with them runs his farm. The farm currently includes a cow, 3 calves and an orchard, where peach, apricot, nut, apple and pear trees are grown. Realizing that the profit from the farm is very important for his family, Narek does his best to gather good harvests and maximize the profit. 

He has applied for this loan to purchase a calf and fertilizer for the cultivation of fruits and vegetables. The loan is important for Narek to expand his farm and be able to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and to purchase fertilizer for the cultivation of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en: Hellena is 45 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with 5 children between 14 and 27 years old. She is a 9th grade dropout. For the past 9 years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sundas

texts.en:
Sundas is a 26-year-old independent woman. Her husband is a government employee, but they are facing many problems in life due to his low salary. For the last two years, she has been helping her husband by successfully running a tuition centre in her home. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to purchase chairs and some required furniture for her tuition centre. She also wants to construct one more room for her tuition centre, as current space is very congested. In this way she can teach more children and her monthly income could be increased. She would save the profit amount for future purposes. She is very hopeful that the loan would be a progressive one for her.

loans.use: To expand her tuition centre.

loans.name: Sammar

texts.en:
Sammar is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Her family consists of her husband and 4 children. Sammar has excellent embroidery skills. She provides embroidery services in her community and all of her clients appreciate her work. 

Presently she is in need of purchasing cloth, needles, colored threads and a variety of stones and laces for her business. For that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Sammar is currently living in a rented house so she wants to purchase her own house in the future. She is hopeful that the loan will be a progressive one for her family.

loans.use: to purchase needles, cloth and thread for embroidery.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 35-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband. She has been running a clothing business in her house for five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to open a small boutique in the market as she is not getting enough customers in her home. She would buy some new varieties of clothing from the profit amount and save some money for the future. She has a bright vision and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To open a boutique in the market and purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena is a 23-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband. Her husband is working in a wood shop and his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past 5 years, with the profession of security guard, he is also driving a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as a lot of repair work is needed on the taxi. 

Nageena has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan, to meet the expenses of repairing the engine and other tuning work on her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Nageena wants to live a happy, peaceful life with her husband, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for such kindness.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA  est constitué de 4 femmes mariées 1 célibataire ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Médine  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les deux précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
SALIMATA, qui est la première femme de la gauche vers droite  fait l’achat vente de condiments (tels les oignons) et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 375 Kilos d’oignons avec les grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is made of of 4 married women and 1 unmarried woman, with an average age of 38, and an average of 3 children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the Médine neighborhood of the village of Bougouni. These women came to know each other through relationships as neighbors, friends, and through business relationships.

To bolster their financial position in order to better operate their business, the women have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, through whom they are on their third loan. Their two previous loans were fully repaid. 

Salimata, who is the first woman pictured on the left, purchases and resells condiments, such as onions. With the loan proceeds, she plans on purchasing 375 kg of onions from wholesalers in Sikasso. She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail both in cash and credit, to a client base made up mostly of women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested into her business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Vidole Group

texts.fr: VIDOLE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Adjowa (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adjowa vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux divers dépenses de la maison, Adjowa vend depuis dix huit ans environs, de la nourriture (haricot et pain) de façon ambulante. Adjowa achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Adjowa et les autres membres du groupe VIDOLE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
VIDOLE is a group of three people who all live in the same neighborhood.

Adjowa (whose hand is raised in the photo) is the group's representative. She is 45 years old and married to a driver named Jean. Adjowa and Jean have four children, all of whom attend school and live in their care. Adjowa lives with her husband and children. Both she and her husband cover the various household expenses.

Adjowa has been selling food (beans and bread) door to door for about eighteen years now, in order to cover the various household expenses. She buys her products at a market in Benin. This is the fifth time that Adjowa and the other members of the VIDOLE group have sought the financial support of ALIDé with a view to increasing their working capital and strengthening their business in order to better meet the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy beans, vegetable oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Mariama.  She is married and has 1 child, age 11 yrs. Mariama has 2 younger sisters who live with her to assist in running her business. In 1998, she established her textiles business. She began her business at an early age with her mother. It was the only activity the family depended on. There was nothing else that could bring income into the home because of the ideology that girl children are not meant for school, but only to be at their marital homes. She was convinced of the concept and decided to be in line with the family. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 
Le 4,500,000. She requires the loan in order to buy 15 rolls of cotton lace @ Le 300,000 each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 1,200,000. 

Mariama is on the verge of completing payment on a shop on one of the busiest streets in town, so that she can have more sales and realize more profit, and also support her husband in educating their child to university level. Hardworking and very grateful, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 15 rolls of cotton lace.

loans.name: Margoth Isabel

texts.es: Doña Margoth es comerciante, vive con su hijo de 21 años, su nuera y su nieto en casa propia y elabora antojitos (papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc) que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su hijo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Margoth pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboracion de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboracion y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y porder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Margoth lives in her own home together with her 21-year-old son, her daughter-in-law and her grandson.  Her business is preparing snacks (French fries, fried cassava, empanadas, tamales, etc.).  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor near her home.  Thanks to her sales, and with the help of her son, she has managed to cover her household expenses.

Margoth is requesting a loan to buy ingredients that she uses in preparing her snacks such as oil, potatoes, corn (for the tamales), plantains, etc.  This will allow her to continue supporting her household and cover any expenses that may occur.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making empanadas, tamales and French fries

loans.name: Makoka Group

texts.en:
Andrew is in his late 30s and married.  He runs two different types of businesses. He has been a photographer for 10 years and has had a motorbike for three years. He works from 5:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to earn a monthly profit.

Andrew is requesting his seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and small items for his cameras.  He used the previous loans to buy a motorbike( bodaboda) for transport, two new cameras for better production and improved photos. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profits to buy a plot of land, build a house, and cover household expenses.   His dream is to have a big studio.

Andrew will share this loan with his loan group Makoka with nine members who hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase spares parts for his motorbike and small items for his cameras.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida de 33 años de edad , esta casada con filder y juntos tienen 4 hijos  quienes comparten sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda propia adquirida con el fruto de su esfuerzo.Tiene como oficio la producción de cacao y café orgánico , trabajo que desempeña en sus propias parcelas.El campo fue una gran oportunidad para iniciarse de manera independiente pues con la llegada de su primer hijo era necesario buscar un sustento fijo para el desarrollo económico de su familia.
Siempre cuenta con el  apoyo de su esposo en las respectivas tareas de mantenimiento para lograr una producción de calidad en cuanto a las mazorcas cacaoteras ya que es la única manera de obtener una producción de calidad la cual es evaluada por los acopiadores de la zona.Al ser una actividad muy trabajosa requiere contar con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar principalmente para le época de cosecha así como el deshierbo de las parcelas.Tiene como objetivo a largo plazo seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza para mejorar su vivienda ubicada en área urbana de su localidad.Esta es su segundo crédito otorgado por Kiva, el cual la motiva en su labor llegando a convertirse en una herramienta de trabajo muy indispensable.
Requiere contar con S/.1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar e iniciar en las próximas semanas con la cosecha correspondiente .
texts.en:
Frida, age 33, is married to Filder.  Together they have four children with whom they share many family experiences in their own home, acquired through the fruit of their efforts.  Her work is the production of cocoa and organic coffee, work which she does in her own parcel of land. The country provided a great opportunity to get her start independently.  With the birth of her first son, it was necessary to look for a steady source of income for the economic development of her family.  

Frida can always count on the support of her husband in the respective tasks needed to ensure high-quality production.  The only way to obtain good production is through the quality of the cocoa pods, which are evaluated by purchasers from the region.  Being a very labor intensive job, it requires some local workers, mainly for harvest time, as well as to clear the land.  Frida's long-term objective is to keep working, with the motivation that is characteristic of her, to improve her home that is located in the urban area of her community.  

This is her second loan granted by Kiva, which motivates her to be an indispensable instrument in her work.  She is seeking 1000 nuevos soles (about $400 US) to contract laborers for the harvest in the coming weeks.

loans.use: to contract local workers.

loans.name: Nincy

texts.es: La Sra. Nincy tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de dos y once años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en la localidad de la Guardia,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Nincy va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un frízer que le hace falta para conservar la carne, verduras,  y refrescos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frizer, la Sra. Nincy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, la Sra. Nincy es una persona joven con ganas de superación su deseo es poder tener un restaurante y así brindar una mejor atención a su clientela y así mejorar su negocio, crecer en clientela y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Nincy is 34 years old and has two children, aged 2 and 11.  Her business is selling food from a sales location in the town of La Guardia.  This loan is her first with the institution and she will use it to buy a freezer that she needs for her meat, vegetables and soft drinks.  She is requesting a loan as she lacks the capital she needs to buy the freezer.

Nincy faces challenges in her business such as growing her customer base.  She will use the profits she makes to improve her family's quality of life.  Nincy is a young person who has a great desire to improve herself.  Her goal is to own a restaurant so that she can provide her customers with a better service, improve her business, increase her number of customers and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Renan

texts.es: El Sr. Renan  sigue con la misma actividad de la agricultura, plantando papa, yuca y variedad de hortalizas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de semillas, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y también para el preparado de la tierra ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda de este producto.
texts.en:
Renan continues working as a farmer, growing potatoes, cassava and a variety of other vegetables.  He reports that his previous loan, which he used to buy seeds, worked out well.

On this occasion, Renan is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds and to prepare the soil as there is a lot of demand for this product at this time of year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to prepare the soil

loans.name: 1 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 1 de diciembre  está en su ciclo número 8, donde 23 mujeres de este grupo están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza. Ellas están trabajando para mejorar sus vidas por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas.
Arminda es parte de este gran grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería, cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que da muy bien servicio a sus clientes. Ella es muy trabajadora ya que empieza todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Con su trabajo puede dar a su familia todo lo que necesita y así ir creciendo mediante su esfuerzo. Es una persona muy sacrificada y que quiere crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuague, cremas, tintes y demás productos para poder seguir dando un bien servicio a sus clientes como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre group is in its eighth cycle.  Twenty-three women in this group are below the poverty line.  They are working in order to improve their lives by all working together.

Arminda is part of this large group.  She is a hairdresser.  She says that she has very good clientele because she gives very good service to her customers.  She is a very hard worker.  She starts working very early every day.  With her work she is able to give her family everything that they need.  This way they are growing through her effort.  She is a very selfless woman who wants to grow.

She is requesting this loan to buy shampoo, rinse, creams, dyes, and other products.  She will do this in order to be able to continue giving her customers good service like she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinse, creams, dyes, and other products.

loans.name: Raila

texts.en:
Raila is a 45-year-old responsible housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family, which consists of her husband and two daughters.  Her husband is a laborer, but he has been unemployed for many days and they are facing a lot of problems in life. 

Raila has been running a small general store since 2010; this is the only source of income for her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. To fulfill customer demands and increase her savings, Raila wants to buy a variety of goods like milk, sugar, bread, rice, soap, creams, etc. and introduce some new items for her general store. 

She would reinvest the profit in her general store, and use a part of it to pay her household expenses. This loan could solve many problems in her life, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for supporting her in this difficult time.

loans.use: To purchase inventory like milk, sugar, bread, rice, soap, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy items for a grocery store.

loans.name: Celso Noel

texts.es:
Celso, requiere un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de agricultura y albañilería. Con esta inversión podrá comprar insumos agrícolas, material y herramientas de albañilería como lo es: pala, azadón, piocha, carreta, entre otros.
Con el crédito anterior le permitió crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar en el taller de bicicletas . Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ya que obtiene mayores ingresos y esto le ha permitido tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Celso needs a new loan as he needs to further invest in his farming and building businesses.  With this loan, he will be able to buy farming supplies and materials, and construction tools (shovel, mattock, pickax, wheelbarrow, etc.)

Celso's previous loan allowed him to grow his business and have available everything he needed to work in his bicycle workshop.  His family's circumstances have improved as he now makes more income.  This has allowed him to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, materials and construction tools (shovel, mattock, pickax, wheelbarrow, etc.)

loans.name: Rosa Edith

texts.es: Doña Rosa se dedica a la comercializacion de muebles de madera cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene clientela y la venta de los muebles le generan buenas ganacias, ella vive con su esposo que trabaja en una tienda de ropa y sus 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años los cuales estudian, con las ganacias que obtine de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran sacar a delante a sus hijos y cubrir los gatos de su hogar. Doña Rosa soliocita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia(los muebles de madera) pues es el unico medio de ingreso que ella tiene y asi poder seguirle dando un mejor calidad de vida a su hijos
texts.en:
Rosa earns her living selling wooden furniture near her place of residence. She has a clientele, and the sale of furniture generates good earnings. She lives with her husband, who works in a clothing store, and their two children, who are 7 and 14 years old and go to school. 

With the profit she makes from her sales, and with the help of her husband, Rosa manages to take care of her children and cover the household expenses.
