She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise (wooden furniture), as that is the only source of income she has; with the loan, she will be able to continue to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to sell.

loans.name: Vimean's Group

texts.en: Vimean is a 22 years old and the mother of one child. She and her family live in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She grows rice on one hectare of land and earns up to 19,000 KHR per day, which she uses to pay for food. She has taken out six previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and has made good use of each of them to improve her family's quality of life. She is now a member of a three-person loan group which is seeking a loan. She and one other member would like to borrow 1,400,000 KHR each while the third member is seeking 1,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion of this loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and rice seeds. She hopes this purchase will help her grow rice in a timely manner so that she can increase her yield and earn more profits to spend on her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: T-Girl

texts.en:
T-Girl is 32 years old and lives in Montserrado county; it has the largest free port, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is single, with a ten-year-old child in school who also lives at home. 

T-Girl has been selling slippers for the past five years in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother, who also taught her this business.   

Her favorite part about her business is it gives her more profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business.  

In the future, she wants to build house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer viuda de 43 años y en su condición de madre soltera tiene la obligación de brindarle a sus 3 hijos lo mejor de si ,juntos viven su casa de material noble .Lucia se dedica a la agricultura , razón por la cual siembra cacao orgánico.Para un producción fluida debe contar siempre con capital y destinarlo a contratar trabajadores del lugar  para agilizar las labores tales como el deshierbo de maleza, deschuponado y posterior cosecha.El cacao orgánico es un producto cuya rentabilidad en su zona varia de acuerdo a la calidad obtenida por ello es indispensable ser constantes en el mantenimiento correspondiente. Paralelo a la contrata de jornaleros debe de contar con sacos de abono orgánico para apoyar a los nutrientes naturales que poseen los terrenos productivos.Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se muestra muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe .En esta oportunidad requiere contar con S/.3,000 nuevos soles y contratar trabajadores del lugar para desempeñar el segundo deshierbo de campaña y la compra de abono orgánico para garantizar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 43-year-old widow and single mother who is raising her three children the best she can.  They live together in their own home which is made from solid building materials.

Lucia's business is farming.  She grows organic cacao.  In order to keep her business running smoothly, she must always have capital available so that she can hire local laborers in order to help with tasks such as weeding, pruning and harvesting.  Organic cacao is a product whose profitability varies according to its quality.  For this reason, it is essential that Lucia constantly provides adequate care for her crops.  In addition to hiring laborers, Lucia must also buy sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can add to the natural nutrients found in her soil.  

This is Lucia's second Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support that she receives.  On this occasion, she needs 3,000 soles to hire local laborers to carry out this season's second weeding.  She will also buy organic fertilizers in order to ensure she produces a good-quality harvest.

loans.use: to hire local laborers and buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fredisminda

texts.es: Fredisminda,solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar pan, pollo, lechuga, aceite, leña, entre otros productos necesarios para seguir en el negocio y brindarle un mejor servicio a los clientes. Esta inversión le permitirá crecer y tener  todo lo requerido para trabajar.
texts.en:
Fredisminda is requesting a new loan to purchase bread, chicken, lettuce, oil, firewood, and other products necessary to continue her business and provide better service to her customers.

This investment will allow her to grow and have everything she requires to work.

loans.use: to purchase bread, chicken, lettuce, oil, firewood, and other products.

loans.name: Las Gardeñas Group

texts.es:
La señora Fidelia de estado civil casada, cuenta con 57 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos; ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino, inició este negocio criando gallinas ponedoras y hasta la fecha lleva 10  años de experiencia, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cerditos para criarlos y luego venderlos, también para comprar concentrado para alimentarlos, en el futuro quiere tener mucho ganado y mucha demanda; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a crianza de gallinas y al comercio.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 57 years old and married, completed six years of primary school education and has five children.  She raises pigs and started out raising egg laying chickens.  She’s been doing this for 10 years and also has her husband’s support; he sells clothing.

She is a member of a group and is asking for a loan which she will use to buy piglets to raise and sell.  She will also buy concentrated feed.  In the future she wants to have lots of livestock and a big demand.  The rest of the group’s members raise chickens and have businesses.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 32 años, ella   se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Porvenir,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Carmen va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de papa y para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, La Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida de la cliente y de su familia La Sra. Carmen es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years old.  She works as a farmer planting a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, yucca, and corn.  Her fields are located in the community of Porvenir.  

This loan is her first with this institution.  Carmen will use this loan to plant potatoes and to prepare the land.  She is requesting this loan in order to obtain resources for the planting.  She will use the benefits to improve her family's quality of life.  

Carmen is a responsible and hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Jose Marcelo

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. Él está acompañado, no tiene hijos y no posee familiares en el extranjero. José labora dicha actividad desde hace 10 años, este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres; lo realiza todos los días de las 6:00 am a 3:00 pm, hasta la fecha no tiene ningún problema.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y todo lo necesario para el cultivo. Este le ayudara para comprar los insumos agrícolas y con las ganancias aportar para la familia.
Su objetivo es aportar siempre a su familia para los gastos económicos que se requieren en el hogar.
texts.en:
José's business is growing corn and beans.  He lives with his common-law wife and doesn't have any children.  He doesn't have any family members abroad either.  José has been working in his business, which he learned from his parents, for 10 years.  He works every day from 6.00am to 3.00pm and, up to now, has not experienced any problems.

José is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and everything else he needs for his crops.  This loan will help him to buy the farm supplies he needs and support his family with the profits he makes.

José's goal is to always support his family with their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and everything else he needs for his crops

loans.name: Liliana Esmeralda

texts.es: Liliana vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras,plátanos, naranjas, piñas, fresas, guineos entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio y de calidad, ella solicita un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, y asi darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Liliana lives with her life partner and daughter in their own house. She sells fruits and vegetables: bananas, oranges, pineapples, strawberries, and plantains. She has gained experience in this business over several years that has contributed to higher earnings. Her stall is strategically located in a well-trafficked area. She has a lot of customers because she offers quality, fresh produce at good prices. She has applied for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo es cliente antiguo de emprender, cuenta que le fue bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de lubricantes, en esta ocasión solicita para lo mismo  compra de lubricantes por mayor para su taller,   ya que esta época tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en: Wilfredo is a longtime client of Emprender. He says his last loan, which he used to buy lubricants, was a success. He is applying for a new loan to buy wholesale lubricants for his shop, as he has a lot of seasonal customers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale lubricants.

loans.name: Banco De Piedra Group

texts.es:
El grupo Banco de piedra está conformado por siete integrantes, el grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad muy tranquila donde generalmente las personas se dedican al cultivo de maíz. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron  porque en la comunidad donde viven hay un banco donde se extrae la piedra la cual se utiliza para construcción de las viviendas.
Tere quien es integrante del grupo cuenta que tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre con Iván desde hace siete años  quien es albañil, juntos han formado una familia con un niño que se encuentra estudiando su educación primaria. Tere se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace cinco años, Tere comenta "Inicie con la venta de mis productos de belleza porque una señora venia a mi casa a ofrecerme los mismos cosméticos y ropa, esta misma persona fue quien me motivo para iniciar con mi propio negocio". Además, es una actividad que le permite a Tere estar con su niño sin tener que descuidarlo por mucho tiempo por lo que también puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de su hijo. Tere plática que en las tardes y cuando está en sus ratos libres visita a sus vecinas para poder ofrecerle  sus productos para también mostrarles sus folletos. Esta Vez Tere está solicitando crédito a la institución para comprar más cosméticos y perfumes que le han solicitado sus clientas. La única dificultad que está presentando Tere es cuando algunas se retrasan con los pagos lo que se le dificulta poder cubrir cubrir su cuota que paga quincenalmente de ahí en fuera nada grave, esto a Tere no le impide tener sueños "Quiero que algún día mi hijo termine una carrera profesional que más le agrade y le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida" Aunque sabe que para lograr esto ella tiene que tener un mejor ingreso por lo que quiere estudiar computación piensa conseguirlo mediante su negocio. Tere tiene metas, así como el resto de los integrantes del grupo es por eso que están solicitando crédito a la institución para poder invertirle a sus negocios Como Don Mario y María Alberta invertirá en sus tienda de abarrotes, Laura, Francisca, Rosa, Basilia, invertirán en cría y engorda de borregos, por eso ellos están muy contentos y agradecidos con Vision Fund y KIVA por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The group Banco de Piedra (Stone Bank) is made up of seven members; they live in a very quiet community where the people generally make a living in growing corn.  They selected this name for their group because in the community where they live, there is a bank where the people extract stone; they then use this stone to construct their homes.

Teresa is the featured member of this group.  She is twenty-eight years old and has lived in a common-law marriage with Iván for seven years.  Iván is a bricklayer.  Together, they have formed a family with one son; he is studying in primary school.  Tere has made a living in selling beauty products for five years.  She says: "I began selling beauty products because a woman came to my house and offered me these same cosmetics and clothes.  This same person was the individual who motivated me to start my own business."  Furthermore, this activity allows Tere to be with her son without having to leave him alone for a lot of time.  She is also able to help her husband with the home expenses and with her son's education.  Tere says that in the afternoons and in her free moments, she visits with her female neighbors in order to offer them her products and to also show them her brochures.  

This time, Tere is requesting a loan in order to buy more cosmetics and perfumes that her clients have requested.  The only difficulty that Tere deals with is when some clients get behind with their payments; this makes it hard for her to be able to cover her own payments that she makes every two weeks.  From there on out, it's nothing too serious.

This doesn't prevent Tere from having dreams: "One day, I want my son to finish his studies for a profession that he likes and that will allow him to have a better quality of life."  She knows that in order to achieve this, she has to have a higher income, since her son wants to study computer science.  She will do this through her business.

Tere has goals, just like the rest of the group members.  For this reason, they are requesting a loan from the institution in order to invest in their businesses: Mario and María Alberta will invest in their grocery stores; Laura, Francisca, Rosa, and Basilia will invest in raising and fattening lambs.  They are very happy and thankful to Vision Fund and to Kiva for the loan that has been offered to them.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Cuna De Belen Group

texts.es: El grupo "Cuna de Belen" se encuentra en una comunidad muy bonita que se identifica por sus grandes tradiciones los integrantes del grupo platican que la fiesta mas grande de la comunidad es el 2 de febrero dia de la Candelaria es una fiesta catolica donde la mayoria de las personas se reunen para celebrar esta virgen. Doña Feliza quien es la representante del grupo tiene 46 años de edad esta casada desde hace 27 años con el señor Miguel quin trabaja de obrero juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos pero ahora ya solo dos dependen de dicha pareja. Doña Feliza se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 27 años Doña Feliza comento "Inicie con la crianza de los cerdos porque mi esposo no tenia trabajo en ese entonces y todos nuestros hijos estaban estudiando nuestros gastos eran demasiados y de alguna manera tenia que apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar" Doña Feliza esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas alimento para que sus cerditos puedan seguir creciendo favorablemente. Doña Feliza cuenta que compra sus cerditos desde chiquitos para crecerlos y engordarlos para venderlos despues de un tiempo sus vecinos generalmente preguntan si tiene cerdos grandes que venda y es cuando Doña Feliza puede venderlos, Solo que su unica dificultad  es la falta de alimentos para sus cerdos esto no la dificultad es la falta de dinero para comprar mas alimento para sus cerditos. El sueño de Doña Feliza es que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y puedan teminar su carrera profesional asi como Doña Feliza tiene ese  sueño tambien los otros integrantes tienen sueños como Don Cirilo invertira en tienda de abarrotes, Aurelia, Josefina, Paulina invertiran en pollos, Celia invertira en reces y Doña Gilberta invertira en cerdos.
texts.en:
The group “Cuna de Belen” is located in a beautiful community that is known for its grand traditions. The members of this group say that Candelaria, which occurs on the 2nd of February, is the best community celebration.  It is a Catholic celebration in which the majority of people gather to honor the Virgen.  
Feliza is the group representative. She is 46 years old. She has been married for 27 years to Miguel who works as a laborer. Together they have six children, but only two are still dependent. Feliza has been raising pigs for 27 years. She says, “I started raising pigs when my husband wasn't working and all of our children were in school. We had many expenses so I wanted to help my husband with the household expenses.” 
Feliza is requesting a loan to buy feed for her piglets so they can continue their healthy growth. She says that she buys piglets when they are very small and raises and fattens them to sell. Her neighbors generally check in with her to find out when her pigs are developed enough to sell. Her one challenge is paying for feed for her piglets. 
Her dream is for her children to have a better future and to become professionals.  Like Feliza, the other members have dreams and will invest their loans in their businesses. Cirilo will invest in his grocery store, Aurelia, Josefina and Paulina will invest in chickens, Celia in cattle and Gilberta in pigs.

loans.use: purchase feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Uugansarnai

texts.en: Ms. Uugansarnai is married, 33 years old and lives with her daughter, two sons and husband in a ger (or traditional Mongolian tent) in an outer district of her town which lacks basic infrastructure. Her daughter attends the local primary school while her sons attend kindergarten. She supports her family by operating a clothing stall at one of the largest indoor markets in her the city. She sells a wide range of children's clothes which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. She said: "to sell children clothes is very beneficial so in the future I want to rent one more stall."

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Chroeb's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chroeb is married and blessed with four school-aged children to take care of. 

She deals with the family's financial burden via rice cropping. To earn more income, her husband works at a construction site during his spare from the field. She has engaged in the current business for ten years, earning about KHR 28,000 per day. 

Chroeb has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva's partner) for seven cycles. She has wisely repaid her past loan to improve her lifestyle in a good way. Now, she is in a group of four to apply for a new loan. 

Chroeb and two other members of Chroeb's Group are seeking for KHR 1,000,000 each, whereas a remaining member is applying for KHR 1,400,000. 

As the group leader, Chroeb will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crop in a timely manner and gain a high yield for her children's sake.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 32-year-old Palestinian woman. She is married and the mother of four children. She is a refugee, living and working in one of the Palestinian camps in Lebanon. Souheir has been working in selling women's, men's and children's clothes since 2011. She also sells accessories and cosmetics.

Souheir is a hard-working woman, who puts in a lot of effort to support her husband in making a living and increasing their income. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her inventory with special spring and newly-released summer clothing collections. This will be her first loan cycle, and she hopes that her future relationship with Al Majmoua will help her invest in her business and develop it in a very good way.

loans.use: To increase her inventory with special spring and newly-released summer clothing collections

loans.name: Ma-Sangay

texts.en:
Ma-Sangay is 40 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 15, who attend school and live at home. Ma-Sangay has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for the past two years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband.   Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. 

Ma-Sangay is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bale of shoes and pay for transportation

loans.name: Rahmattilo

texts.ru: Рахматтило предыдущий кредит брал в сезон бахчевых культур. Он посеял арбуз и получил богатый урожай. Очередной кредит Рахматтило берет для создания нового бизнеса. Он хочет заняться животноводсвом, а именно купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота, так как это прибыльнее и не требует тяжелой работы. К тому же у Рахматтило есть земельный участок для пастбища и оно находится недалеко от скотного рынка. Кредит Рахматтило берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота и его корма.
texts.en: Rahmattilo took out his previous loan during the melon season. He planted watermelon and reaped a rich harvest. He is now seeking another loan to start up a new business. He wants to get into animal husbandry, specifically buying and selling cattle, because it is profitable and does not require a great deal of physical labour. In addition, he has a plot of land that can be used as pasture, and which is located not far from the cattle market. Rahmattilo is seeking a loan to purchase cattle and cattle feed.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Gloria de 55 años de edad, esta casada y vive con su esposo en una aldea jal sur de Honduras,  tiene casa propia.  Se dedica desde hace más de 10 años al negocio que es la venta de abarrotería donde vende lo que es fresco, agua en bolsa, churros, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca en kilo, café y refrescos etc. 
Doña Gloria vende diariamente de lunes a domingo en su negocio, sus clientes son las personas  de su comunidad y pescadores.
Doña Gloria solicita su préstamo para la compra de mercadería como manteca, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, mantequilla, queso, leches, café, pan etc. para surtir más su negocio.
Doña Gloria Con el apoyo del préstamo espera surtir un poco su pulpería y por ende mejorar sus ingresos,  su deseo es seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
Doña Gloria su sueño es que se le mejoren las ventas y tener buenos clientes que le sean puntuales. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Marzo 2013
texts.en:
Gloria, 55, is married and lives with her husband in their own house in a town in southern Honduras. For over ten years, she has run a grocery store, where she sells fresh foods, bags of water, churros, beans, rice, sugar, kilos of margarine, coffee, and beverages. Gloria business is open every day, and her customers are neighbors and fishermen. 

Gloria is applying for a loan to buy margarine, beans, sugar, rice, butter, cheese, milk, coffee, and bread to stock her business. Gloria expects to have more inventory and, therefore, more income with the loan. She wants to keep working with Prisma. Her dream is to increase sales and have customers who pay promptly.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to buy margarine, beans, sugar, rice, butter, cheese, milk, coffee, and bread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for all types of phones.

loans.name: Carlos Ismael

texts.es: Don Carlos es agricultor desde hace varios años, se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijoles y maicillo y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar pero no le alcanza para pagar el arrendamiento de tierra donde cosecha sus cultivos, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Don Carlos solicita un credito para pagar el arrendamiento y poder comprar insumos agricolas que le sirven para su cultivo y asi poder seguir cultivando como siempre lo ha hecho y poderle dar una mejor vida a su familia
texts.en: Carlos has been working in agriculture for several years; he grows corn, beans and sorghum and uses profits earned to cover his household expenses but they don’t stretch far enough to be able to also pay for his farmland rental fees.  He lives with his wife and three children.  Carlos is requesting a loan to pay his rental fees and to be able to buy farm supplies he needs for his crops so that he can continue growing crops like he’s always done and be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to pay farmland rental fees.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, ya que este le permitirá comprar leña y luego venderla para el invierno, así tener el producto a tiempo para cuando lo necesite.
Con el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar su inventario. Las condiciones familiares han mejorado y las circunstancias económicas gracias a las ganancias que genera.
texts.en:
Oscar’s requesting a new loan because he needs to invest more in the business; it will make it possible for him to buy firewood to then sell it in the winter.  This way he’ll have product stocked for when he needs it.

The previous loan helped him increase his inventory.  His family condition has improved and so has his economic circumstances thanks to the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy firewood for the winter.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia, tiene 41 años de edad ,esta casada con Roberto y tiene 03 hijos , con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe en donde comparte sus vivencias familiares. Tiene como principal oficio la venta de diversos productos comestibles tales como gaseosas, galletas y diversas golosinas.Desempeña su negocio en el primer piso de su vivienda .Anteriormente se desempeñaba en el campo realizando diversas labores agrícolas para poder juntar dinero y establecer su actual negocio.
Al ser una madre muy empeñosa  ha logrado motivarse con el crecimiento constante de su negocio cuyo objetivo a largo plazo es ampliarlo y convertirlo en una gran tienda de abarrotes .Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva motivo por el cual agradece la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntal.
Requiere contar con S/.2,000 nuevos soles y destinarlos a la compra de más golosinas para su negocio tales como chocolates, galletas  y helados.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 41, is married to Roberto and has 3 children. They live together in an adobe house, where they share experiences. Eugenia sells a variety of food items such as sodas, cookies, and candies from a space on the first floor of her house. She worked in the fields at different farming tasks before she was able to get money together to start her current business.

As a dedicated mother, her motivation has been growing her business. Her long-term goal is to expand and open a bigger grocery store. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make her payments on time. She needs S/.2000 nuevos soles to buy more candies, chocolates, cookies, and ice cream for her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, cookies, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cows, and fertilizer for his soil

loans.name: Almaza

texts.en:
Almaza is a 52-year-old widow and mother of three children. She has been baking traditional Lebanese Saj bread and Manakish for the past nineteen years in order to provide her orphans a good and healthy living. Almaza is a hard worker who has sacrificed her whole life for the sake of raising her children and supporting them.

Almaza is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to start a new business. She will open a mobile shop and she will make sure to stock prepaid cards because they are highly requested in the market.

This is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She invested her previous loan in increasing her present business capital, and it had a positive impact. She hopes that this new loan will help fulfill her family's needs and satisfy their desires.

loans.use: To start a new mobile phone shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Fanta. She is married and has four children, ages 25, 17, 15, and 8 years. 

In 1995, she established her garri [cassava flakes], beans, groundnut [peanuts], and bennie seed [sesame seed] business. She began her business because she wants to fight poverty and also to help her husband run the home and adequately care for the children. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 (leones) every month from this business. 

Fanta would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri, beans, groundnuts, and bennie seed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the shop inventory for good sales.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hawa.  She is married and has four children, aged 20, 17, 15 and 13. She has four additional dependents that live with her as younger sisters.  In 2000, Hawa established her ladies' handbags business. She began her business because her husband did not care for her and the children. Since she wants her children to be brought up well, she decided to go into business to gain her own source of revenue. 

Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 a month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Hawa needs the loan in order to buy Le 4,500,000 worth of bags. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. She succeeded in establishing an outlet for one of her sisters which has considerably increased her revenue base. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy Le 4,500,000 worth of bags.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly parents).  She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for eight years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis.   She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  

Rose generates additional income from frying pancakes, chapati and samosa to sell.  She works from her home seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves, transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring of acquiring a delivery van to ease in transportation and also becoming a wholesaler and also building rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 37 years old. She sells cassava flour and has been in the business for 10 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more cassava flour for sale, and she has an intention of building a house from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Verene

texts.en: Verene is 27 years old, married to a technician and the mother of two children. She has spent six years in the business of selling food items, and has done well enough to improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting this loan to buy more beans and cassava to sell. She will use the additional profits she earns to improve her home so that her family can live more comfortably in it.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and beans to sell.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard is in the business of selling women's clothing and underwear from a rented shop in one of the city’s markets. She works hard to satisfy customer demand, and is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for her shop. She is sure that this loan will increase her sales and keep her business competitive. Alvard lives with her son and does everything she can to ensure a better life for him.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Masvingo Ten Stars Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Addlight from Masvingo. She is married with four children, one attending school.  

Addlight is into the poultry business, which has been in operation for ten years. She says the main challenges faced are of delayed settlements from debtors and some who fail to pay. Addlight has requested a loan of $600 to buy chicks and stockfeeds. 

Addlight says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her household income, thereby improving the quality of life. In the future, Addlight plans to own a shop in town.

loans.use: to buy stockfeeds and chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries and clothes.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 28 years old. She is married and has two children, only one of whom goes to school. She has owned a shop for three years. With the loan, she wants to purchase more corn flour and sugar for resale. She is planning to use the profits to reinvest in her existing business.

loans.use: To buy more corn flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, and groceries

loans.name: Claude

texts.en: Claude, aged 30, is single and owns a general store which he has been running for one year. He has requested this loan to buy more items for sale such as salt, sugar, and rice. With the profits from the business, he will buy a plot of land for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale such as salt, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Primavera 2009 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA 2009”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Estephanie es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de fruta, venta de chalecos y mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Estephanie es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y jugos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió a concejo de su madre quien vendía lo mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de naranjas y licuadoras) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse y mantener a sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Primavera 2009” communal bank will start its ninth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board presided over by Estephanie.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are neighborhood store, blanket weaving, fruit sales, vest sales and blanket sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen like Estephanie.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  At present, she has a business selling fruit and fruit juice.  She relates that she started the business on advice from her mother who sold the same thing.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy oranges and blenders from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then sell in her stand.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support herself and her parents.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the credit.

loans.use: to buy oranges and a blender.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y ropa. Ella tiene 47 años de edad, casada y su esposo tiene 48 años de edad, disfruta de sus dos hijos los cuales tiene edades de 8 y 11 años. Lorena, ya posee 8 años de contar con el negocio, lo realiza de lunes a sábado y lo aprendió con una amiga.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar  perfumes y ropa para así surtir el negocio para la clientela. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y con ello obtener más ganancias.
Su objetivo es fortalecer más su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena sells perfume and clothing. She is 47 years old and married. Her husband is 48 years old. She enjoys her two children, who are 8 and 11 years old. Lorena has had her business for 8 years and makes her sales from Monday to Saturday. She learned the business with a friend. 

The loan she needs will enable her to purchase perfume and clothing and stock her business for her customers. This investment will help her to increase inventory and earn more income. Her objective is to strengthen her business and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and clothing and stock her business.

loans.name: Puerta Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUERTA DEL SOL”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ovejas, venta de gorras, venta de comida, venta de vasos de cristal, tienda de abarrotes, venta de pescado, tejido de mantas, venta de coca y fruta

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de ovejas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace pocos años con las ovejas que le regalaron sus padres cuando tuvo su primer hijo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ovejas) que adquirirá de las ferias provinciales y lo comercializará en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The 'Puerta del Sol' community bank is about to start its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors, with Amalia serving as its president.  The businesses that the members of this community bank are engaged in are varied and include: sheep sales, hat sales, food sales, selling drinking glasses, weaving blankets, selling coca leaf and selling fruit. 

This loan will benefit these small micro businesswomen.  Amalia says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having joined through an invitation from a friend who was already a member.  Amalia has a small business selling sheep for meat.  She says that she set up the business a few years ago with some sheep that her parents gave her as a gift when she had her first child.

Amalia is requesting this loan to increase her working capital.  She will buy sheep in the provincial markets and then later sell them in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make income.  She lives with her common-law husband and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Amalia replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Wendy Lissette

texts.es:
Wendy, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Ella tiene 19 años de edad, soltera y vive con su mama  que tiene 48 años de edad y tiene un hermano, el negocio es familiar y su padre falleció hace un tiempo atrás. Wendy, trabaja todos los días junto a su madre de esta forma le permite para estudiar.
El crédito que requiere le ayudara para comprar alimento para cerdos. Este le generara incremento en los cerdos y así obtener mayores utilidades. 
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy raises pigs. She is 19, single, and lives with her 48-year-old mother and brother. This is a family business, and her father died a while back. Wendy works with her mother every day, which allows her to study as well.

She will use this loan to buy feed for her pigs. She will increase her stock so that she can earn more income. Her goal is to strengthen her business and offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Flor De Umacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE UMACHA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de cebolla, venta de materiales escolares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de material escolar; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años con el apoyo de su pareja actual.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el mejoramiento de sus herramientas (compra materiales escolares) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en diversas ferias de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Flor de Umacha communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office.  It is comprised of nine members, and it is headed by a board of directors.  Flor is the president.  The diverse businesses of the members of the communal bank include selling food, selling groceries, selling onions, and selling school supplies.

The loan that they will get will benefit small business people like Flor, who is a member.  She says this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to visit Flor at her house.

She currently has a business selling school materials.  She began this business several years ago with the support of her current life partner.

The loan that she will now get is for the improvement of her supplies (she will buy school materials).  She will get them at the store in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell them at the different fairs in her community.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has three children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the trainings about loans and health.

loans.use: to buy school materials.

loans.name: Anisie

texts.en: Anisie is 35 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling clothes. She will use this loan to buy more items to sell and use the additional profits she earns to expand her business. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard to have greater success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gyulizar

texts.en:
Gyulizar is a single mother with three little children living in Lukashin village of Armavir region. She keeps 100 sheep and grows plum trees. Gyulizar works hard to gather a good harvest and sustain her children.

Gyulizar has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for her to be able to feed the livestock and use fertilizer in cultivation of different types of fruits and vegetables. With the loan's help Gyulizar hopes to expand her farming business and ensure a better life for her children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Komborero Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Ledwin from Masvingo. She is married and has three children, all of whom are attending school. She also cares for one dependent. 

Ledwin runs an agriculture business of selling chickens. The business has been in operation for 10 years. The challenge she faces in her business is the death of chicks due to some diseases. Ledwin has requested a loan of $800 to buy an additional cage for her chicks, more chicks, and stock feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her business and income, which will enable her to send her children to good schools. In the future, Ledwin plans to have a large poultry structure that can house over a thousand birds.

loans.use: to buy an additional cage, chicks, and stock feed.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 27 years old. She sells clothes and is married to a businessman. She has spent five years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more types of clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en: Alexandre is 35 years old. He is a father of two children aged two and nine years old. He sells timber and has been selling those products for four years. With the loan, he wants to buy more timber for sale and the profit will be dedicated to buying home-use furniture.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale.

loans.name: Varsik

texts.en:
Varsik has been involved in agriculture for eight years. She is a young mother of two children and lives with her husband and mother-in-law. 

Varsik owns agricultural land where she grows peaches, apricots, plums and nut trees with great love and pleasure. Together with her husband, she works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local market. The agricultural business is the only source of income for Varsik and her family so she would like to expand it.

She has applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds and cover cultivation costs. The loan is important for Varsik to start the cultivation of the tomatoes and gather more harvest and cover cultivation costs.

Varsik hopes that the loan will ease her daily problems and she will be able to support her  children adequately.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been involved in agriculture almost 10 years. She runs a farm which includes five mother pigs, 10 little pigs, 30 chickens and 6 colonies of bees. She also cultivates potatoes and haricots as well as growing three apple trees. She lives in Verishen village with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 

Anahit's son helps her to take the gathered harvest to the local market and sell it. Realizing that agriculture helps the family to have stable income, Anahit would like to expand it. She has applied for this loan to pay for two mother pigs, eight little pigs and forage for feeding them. This is very important for Anahit to earn more agricultural income and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two mother pigs, eight little pigs and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
In 2005, Hawa established her school and ladies’ bags business. She began her business just after her father died, as there was no other means for her to get money to solve some of her problems. As a mature lady at that time, she decided to engage herself by assisting her friends in doing business until she got her own capital to start her own business.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy assorted bags by the bale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. 

In the future, Hawa plans to rent a shop, so that her business will be more attractive to customers; this can increase her revenue base, hence improve on the standard of living for her and her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted bags by the bale.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Isata B.  She is married and has four children who are 18, 16, 12 and 8 years old. In 2005, Isata B established her school bags, traveling bags & ladies bags business. She began her business because she inherited it from her mother and since she was not fortunate enough to go to school, she decided to use the business as her own career. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Isata B requires a loan to buy more bags by the bale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 700,000. In the future, Isata B plans to rent a spacious shop to sell bags for both gents and ladies. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags by the bale.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Abu. He is single, and has five children, ages 18, 16, 13, 11, and 8. In 1991, Abu established his business selling beer, stout, soft drinks, wine, etc. He began his business because he wants to be self reliant and also to adequately provide for his children’s needs. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy some drinks and to do a little bit of expansion. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,000,000 SLL. In the future, Abu plans to run a full-time bar. He is hardworking and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy some drinks

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Dora.  She is married and has four children, all adults. In 2008, Dora established her bread, cheese, butter, biscuits, milk, and soap and sardine business. She began her business because she wanted to be independent and not to be a burden to her children. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Dora requires a loan to buy more goods that are requested for daily use by her customers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Dora plans to open a big business for her grandchildren as a legacy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has three children who are 28, 24 and 22 years old. In 2008, Zainab established her provisions and drinks business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Zainab requires a loan to add to her stock to satisfy her customers at all times. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Zainab plans to rent another shop very close to her shop, as the one presently in use is too small for the way her business is growing. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has five children aged 15, 10, 8, 5, and 3 years old. In 1997, Mohamed established his local foodstuff business. He began his business just to earn income. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy local rice. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,000,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to become a leading supplier of local foods. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy local rice

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor Branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She has been selling used clothing for about three years, which she started with her first loan with Esperanza Internacional. After six loans, her business has been improving and expanding to serve more clients and to offer more products. She will buy various clothing packages, which are all used clothes in good condition that she sells by the piece. 

Clara lives with one of her three children and her husband in their simple structure home. She said that her most difficult challenge is to build a concrete block house to be safer and in better condition. She enjoys working in her business. She is very excited to be receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She plans to save the profits for future investments and needs. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy used clothes

loans.name: Caterine Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Caterine vive hace 10  años en la ciudad es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de salir delante, ella tiene una familia muy bonita tiene a su esposo y su hija de 9 años.
Siempre le ha gustado estudiar, sus padres Joaquin y Patricia le dieron la oportunidad de cursar sin ningún contratiempo la primaria y el bachillerato de los que tiene recuerdos muy gratos como, ser una muy buena alumna, haber participado en diversas actividades deportivas, en danzas, banda marcial ,etc. sus padres a pesar de ser separados hace mucho tiempo le inculcaron valores muy importantes como: apreciar todo lo que la vida le pueda ofrecer, así mismo ella siguió sus estudios y presento exámenes de admisión en la universidad Autónoma para seguir con la carrera profesional de Odontología donde tuvo éxito y pudo empezar sus estudios como ella lo había soñado; sin embargo como la vida suele tener altibajos su mama cabeza de familia de cuatro hijos  quien era la proveedora económica de su estudio no pudo seguir apoyándola y así ella dejo de estudiar  odontología.
Mas adelante ella misma con sus ingresos laborales pago y realizo  una serie de diplomados para  poder mejorar de alguna manera su perfil laboral y académico, Caterine nunca dejo de tener como meta terminar sus estudios o cursar una carrera profesional así que como muchos en esta vida trabaja junto con su esposo fuertemente para poder estudiar Contabilidad financiera. Ella sabe que poco a poco, peldaño por peldaño se llega a la sima y que con el apoyo de su familia y el empeño que ella le ponga, su sueño finalmente se hará realidad.
Una de las cosas mas importantes para Caterine es mostrarle a su hija y a muchos que la edad  y los hijos no son inconvenientes para llegar a la meta.
Ella sabe que con el pasar del tiempo y con la experiencia que dan los años pudo enfocarse con mayor seriedad y responsabilidad en lo que hoy es su prioridad después de su familia y es llegar a obtener la tarjeta profesional no en odontología como ella escogió en un principio sino como contadora y especializarse en finanzas, como su vida y vivencias le han mostrado que es lo que realmente ella sabe hacer. 
Ella sin duda alguna da gracias por que ha disfrutado la vida de manera que no se arrepiente de todo lo que ha hecho  que sin duda alguna la han formado en su carácter, responsabilidad, respeto y conciencia. Caterine solo espera poder contar con salud, una mejoría económica y laboral para llegar a su nueva meta pero no al final de su vida; ya que piensa que tiene muchos sueños por cumplir y muchas metas por alcanzar, sin duda alguna ella y su gran corazón la llevaran muy lejos.
texts.en:
Caterine has lived in the city for ten years; she’s an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She has a lovely family: a husband and a nine-year-old daughter.

She’s always enjoyed studying.  Her parents, Joaquín and Patricia, gave her the opportunity to attend elementary and high school problem-free and she has very pleasant memories of those days like being a very good student, of participating in various sports activities, in dances, in the marching band, etc.  Despite her parents being separated, they always instilled in her very important values like the appreciation for everything life can provide for her.  She continued her studies and took the admission tests for the Autonomous University to continue a professional career in dentistry where she was successful and was able to start her studies like she wanted to.  However, as life is wont to do, there were highs and lows.  Her mother, who was head of household with four children and provided economically for her studies, was unable to continue doing so and she had to drop out of the dentistry program.

Later on with her own income earned at work she took a series of courses to be able to improve her work and academic profiles.  Caterine never stopped aiming at finishing her studies leading to a professional degree so like many others she works hard alongside her husband in order to be able to study financial accounting.  She knows that little by little, climbing up step by step, one reaches the summit and that with support from her family and the effort she herself puts into it her dream will finally become reality.

One of the most important things for Caterine is to show her daughter and many others that age and having children is no obstacle to reach one’s goals.

She knows that with the passage of time and with the experience years provides one can focus more seriously and responsibly on what one's priorities are today which besides her family are to attain her professional degree not in her original choice of dentistry perhaps but as an accountant specializing in finance which life and her life experiences have shown her to be what she’s really good at.

Without a doubt, she’s thankful for everything she’s enjoyed in life and she does not regret anything she’s done for it has all led to forming her character: responsibility, respect and conscience.

Caterine only hopes to be in good health and to improve her economy and her work so that she can reach a new goal.  But this isn’t the end; she believes she still has many dreams to reach and many goals to attain.  Undoubtedly she and her great heart will go far.

loans.use: to finish her financial accounting coursework.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, esta acompañado. Actualmente, vive junto con sus padres en el mismo terreno; pero en casa separadas. Trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda ganadera, también es agricultor cultiva junto a su padre desde los doce años de edad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla de maíz y pipían para cultivar 3,500 metros cuadrados y comprara concentrado y vitaminas para el ganado que posee. Él desea aprovechar, ya que esta muy próxima la época para empezar a sembrar y posiblemente con el dinero que gane le permita sembrar más. Su deseo es poseer cinco vacas lecheras para vender lácteos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old and has a partner. Currently he lives on the same land with his parents but in a separate house. He works as a day laborer on a cattle ranch. He is also a farmer, and has been farming with his father since he was twelve years old.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase corn and pumpkin seed to cultivate 3,500 square meters and also to buy feed and vitamins for the cattle he owns. He wants to take advantage of the coming season and begin planting so that possibly with the money he earns he will be able to plant even more. His desire is to own five milk cows and sell dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase corn and pumpkin seed to cultivate 3,500 square meters and to buy feed and vitamins for the cattle he owns.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir  cultivando maíz, plátano y lo necesario para llevar acabo el cultivo. Este le permitirá comprar abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas, herbicidas, preparar el terreno y pago de los mozos. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a realizar una excelente siembra de plátanos y maíz, ya que logro obtener dos cosechas gracias a este. La familia se ha mantenido, sus ingresos han mejorado, ya que le permito comprar unos tubos para mejorar su vivienda, su deseo es cultivar más para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz is applying for another loan because he needs to continue cultivating corn and bananas, and he needs the supplies necessary to plant these crops. This loan will allow him to buy fertilizer, pesticide, insecticide, and herbicide, as well as to prepare his land and pay workers.

His previous loan helped him to prepare excellent plots of bananas and corn, as he was able to obtain two harvests thanks to the loan. He has maintained his family, his earnings have improved, and he was able to buy pipes to improve his house. His wish is to plant more in order to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, insecticide, and herbicide, to prepare his land, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Jenny Andrea

texts.es: Es una mujer de 28 años con 2 hijos uno de ellos con autismo vive en unión libre el no es el padre de sus hijos, ellos  pagan arriendo, colegio de los niños, comida, gastos diarios entre los dos , su suegra la mama de su esposo tiene 60 años ella le colabora para pagar en la institución ya que ellos no pueden  por los gastos que tienen; su  esposo trabaja por días y no tiene un sueldo fijo y ella  gana el  mínimo, que prácticamente es lo del arriendo donde viven. Su suegra le colabora con lo de la  carrera pero ella ya está un poco mal de salud y hay momentos que ella siente pena pues ella no es la abuela de los niños, sin embargo, ella le ayuda y quisiera el préstamo para que no le toque tan pesado a ella y de cierta manera que ustedes le ayudaran a ella ya que por ella y por ustedes podría sacar su carrera para un futuro mejor para los niños y más el de Nicolás pues él tiene autismo leve, y no ha podido llevarlo a un instituto o colegio para él, que sea especializado, los gastos de la casa son altos y tratamos de que no se les agranden los servicios y mantener el arriendo al día, en el mercado compran lo  básico y poco y sin poder  darles lujos de salidas o cosas especiales para los niños y ellos, la suegra también le colabora en el mercado la mayoría de veces
texts.en:
Jenny is 28 and has two children, one of whom is autistic. She lives in a free union; her partner is not the father of her children. Together they pay for rent, the children's education, food, and other daily expenses. Her mother-in-law is 60 and helps them pay expenses that they otherwise could not meet. Her partner is a day laborer and does not have a fixed income. Jenny earns a minimum wage, which barely covers the rent. 

Her mother-in-law has helped pay Jenny's education expenses, but she is not feeling well. At times, she feels sorry for them. Though she isn't the children's grandmother, she helps Jenny and hopes she secures a loan so that her burden isn't so great. In a way, she wants them to help her.

If Jenny can finish her professional program, she could offer her children a brighter future, especially for Nicolás, who is autistic. She has not been able to find a specialized institution or school for him. The household expenses are high, and they try to keep services in line and pay the daily rent. They shop just for basic items and aren't able to go out or buy special things for the children and themselves. Her mother-in-law helps them buy things in the market most of the time.

loans.use: to finish the nurse assistant program.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde hace 5 años inició su propio negocio, basado en productos que vende mediante guías especializadas o catálogos que le ofrecen grandes instituciones comerciales. Su idea de negocio inició cuando al quedar viuda,  requirió obtener ingresos que le sirvieran para sostener a sus tres hijos; los principales productos de su oferta son los  perfumes, cremas, prendas de plata etc. 
Su actividad comercial inició  dirigida a sus vecinas más cercanas y a su familia, pero poco a poco la ha ido extendiendo a diversos sectores de la comunidad. En la actualidad planea incrementar sus ventas, para dar respuesta a la demanda del mercado, pero sus ingresos no son suficientes para extenderse e incrementar sus ingresos tanto como ella quisiera;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, productos de higiene personal, entre otros artículos que ha definido al hacer su preventa. Su meta es aportarle cada vez mas a los ingresos familiares y su mayor desafío es tener suficiente recurso financiero para crecer rápidamente.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in the city of Barranquilla.  Five years ago, she set up her own business here selling products through specialized magazines or catalogs from large commercial institutions.  Her business idea came about when she was widowed and found herself needing to make income in order to support her three children.  She mainly sells perfumes, creams and silver jewelry.  

At first, Fanny would sell her products to her closest neighbors and family members but she gradually expanded into other areas of her community.  She currently plans to increase her sales and meet market demand.  However, her income isn't enough to expand and increase her sales as much as she would like.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will buy perfumes, personal care products and other products that she has pre-sold.  Her goal is to contribute more and more towards her family income.  Her biggest challenge is having enough financial resources available to grow her business quickly.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and personal care products

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 40-year-old married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a very hardworking farmer who grows tea that she directly sells to the factory in the neighborhood. With the proceeds she has been able to venture into dairy farming and pay school fees for her children. Like most farmers she has challenges of unpredictable weather changes and high cost of operations while her dream is to expand her tea plantation and become the leading grower. Mariam intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Amiri

texts.en: Amiri is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Since 2007 he has been running a retail shop but also grows cocoa as his primary activity. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his child up to the university and set up sustainable, income-generating activities despite inadequate capital. Amiri intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Argentina is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope) 4. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She is a divorced woman.

Argentina sells miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and others. She started her business with some savings and by taking credits from different suppliers. This is how she financed her business until she was invited to a meeting where her neighbors explained about Esperanza International and this program. She was very excited and took out her first loan to invest in her business. That was almost five years ago. Now, she is taking her ninth loan with Esperanza International.

Argentina is excited to be taking this loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She is planning to use it to increase her inventory. She is running a 'Fantasia' (a small miscellaneous product store). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 24-year-old married man and a father with one son.  

For the past year, Nidal has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. Nidal is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Nidal to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Nidal appears in Kiva profile.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 28-year-old married man.  For the past three years, Adel has had a mini-market selling different types of food.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover his costs.

Adel is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing needed stock that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase Adel's income.

Adel appears in his mini-market.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for his minimarket

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 19-year-old single young man. His mother is a worker with a very low income that barely cover the family needs. Mahmoud is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mahmoud to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mahmoud and improve the family's living conditions. Mahmoud is photographed at the store where he purchased the laptop.

loans.use: to pay for a new laptop

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is 32 years old, a married man and a father with one son. For the past three years, Jamal has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Jamal is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Jamal appears in in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the cost of purchasing more sheep

loans.name: Resistencia 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ylena is the coordinator of her group "Resistencia 1, 2, 3 & 4" ("Resistance"). The group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She is a single mother. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them.

Ylena is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. She started doing business almost two years ago, walking with a bag of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. 

Ylena plans to use this loan to invest in her business and she will buy cosmetics and women's accessories. She will also increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous items. She will use her business profits to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and women's accessories to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Doña carmen se dedica a la venta de pescado seco desde hace varios años en diferentes mercados de la zona vive con su esposo que es comerciante de plastico y con sus dos hijos que estudian, con la venta que realiza puede sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder pagar las gastos que tiene en su hogar, ella solicita credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia pescado fresco y oreado ya que tiene mucha demanda y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Carmen has had a business selling dried fish at different markets in the area for several years. She lives with her husband, who sells plastics, and her two children, who are in school. Her sales enable her to help her children get ahead and pay household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fresh and dried fish merchandise because there is a big demand for it. Thus she will be able to continue earning more profits and providing a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Yvrose

texts.en:
Yvrose lives in Port Salut, Haiti, about a 5-hour drive from the capital Port-au-Prince. She already has a business selling mobile phones and phone credit. She has started to sell clean energy products with EarthSpark as clean energy entrepreneur.
With the help of a Kiva loan last year, she was set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  She sold out of her products so quickly that she has paid off her loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. This time, she would like to continue her business and is asking for a new loan. With this money, she will continue to sell solar desk lamps and efficient stoves.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 29 años de edad, es casado,  él vive con su familia en una casita muy humilde que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Desde muy pequeño se dedico a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre y hermanos donde fue aprendiendo a cultivar diferentes productos como papa, cebolla, maní, frejol etc.; Francisco vivía  en la casa de sus padres junto a su familia, sin embargo decidió independizarse y trasladarse a su casa propia, para ya no depender más de sus padres y cuidar de su propia familia. Francisco está solicitando este crédito para comprar semillas, abono químico y agroquímicos, así empezar su propia producción agrícola y mejorar su calidad de vida; el  trabaja en  pequeñas parcelas que tiene con toda su familia. También tiene la clara idea de que con este crédito mejorara las condiciones, solvencia económica y que en las próximas oportunidades realizara inversiones con créditos mayores que le permitirán emprender negocios con utilidades de mayor valor económico.
texts.en:
Francisco is 29 years old and married. He lives with his family in a very modest house that was built with great effort. From a very young age, he has been farming with his father and his siblings. This is how he learned to cultivate different products such as potatoes, onions, peanuts, beans, and other crops.

Francisco had lived at his parents’ house along with his own family, but he decided that he wanted to be independent, so he and his family moved into a house of their own. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, and agrochemicals. Francisco plans to start producing his own crops so that he can improve his quality of life. He works on small parcels of land that he shares with his entire family. Francisco has a clear idea that this loan will improve his conditions and his financial solvency. With upcoming opportunities, he plans to invest larger loans so that he can establish profitable businesses that have great economic value.

loans.use: to buy seeds (onions, carrots, and beans), chemical fertilizers, and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She has been running her business for five years, cooking for her business which is a fried food stall,  where she sells chicken, beef, fried rounds make of dough, fried plantains and other fried food.

Inocencia will purchase meat, cooking oil, plantains, seasoning and other goods. She will use this loan to buy all the goods also to save capital to buy any utensils or equipment. Inocencia is still a single women and what she wants most is to have her family. She enjoys working and cooking.

Inocencia is very excited to be receiving her eighth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because she will improve her sales. She plans to save the profits for future reinvestment. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy meat, cooking oil, plantains, potatoes, flour, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has a wife and two children. This hardworking man is a computer technician, and his business is a repair center. He found the need to do service in his community and used his knowledge to serve people and sell them the parts they need to have better equipment.
